snippet.title: At least 15 injured after two trams collide in Melbourne's CBD
snippet.content: Two trams have collided in Melbourne's CBD, causing minor injuries at least 15 commuters. Authorities were called to Bourke and Spencer Streets around 2:30pm today after one tram collided with another from behind near Southern Cross Station. It is believed 15 people, including six children, have suffered minor injuries and are being assessed by paramedics. Yarra Trams said the 86 and 96 routes, which both travel on Bourke Street, are being diverted. They are diverting via La Trobe Street between Spencer Street and Melbourne Museum. (C) Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
